author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Ænglish land, a labor camp lay,
Whence ínnocent men travaileth hence,
With little mercy, no reprieve seen,
In Mordovia's dreary dwelling they pray.

Old folk tend t'wards stocks with care,
Investing in dreams, they seek fortune's face,
Yet, ensnared, they clutch onto hope's vine,
Two-thirds in feats of gamble do dare.

To fair Beijing comes Blinken, sincere,
Entreaties made for parley and peace,
For though Chínese paint urgent need hís,
Each hath cause for détente to appear.

feedItems.title: Americans Describe Harsh Life in Russian Labor Camp
feedItems.description: Inmates of IK-17 in Russia’s Mordovia region struggle with hazardous work and meager medical care. It could be the next destination for jailed Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich.

feedItems.title: Boomers Got Hooked on Stocks. Now They Can't Let Go.
feedItems.description: Nearly two-thirds of U.S. adults age 65 and older have money in stocks.

feedItems.title: After Months of Cold Shoulder, China Welcomes Blinken to Beijing
feedItems.description: Chinese officials have painted the U.S. as most eager to meet, but have their own reasons for detente.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of faltering realms and work unbent,
Where companies in twilight dwell,
And layoff's haunting ethers quell,
As looming storms o'er yonder swell.

A hero's tale, a fame that whispers,
Of Bob the Huggins, coach of misters,
And yet despair doth grip him fast,
For vile arrest his name is lashed.

A dreary strand by ignorant youth,
In newfound halls their manners proof,
As office ways they grasp but naught,
A tale of woe and lessons taught.

feedItems.title: Lots of Hiring, but Not So Much Working
feedItems.description: Companies are resisting layoffs even as economic weakness looms.

feedItems.title: Hall of Fame West Virginia Coach Bob Huggins Resigns Following Arrest
feedItems.description: His resignation, following an arrest on Friday, comes after an earlier incident in which he was suspended for using an antigay slur.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: New graduates have absolutely no idea how to behave in the office

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Oh, haste no more to check thy coin,
For times be bleak, reflections dire,
In 401(k) gaze not thine eye,
As winter wolves bemoan the pyre.

When sun did rise o’er Uganda fair,
In havens of the hallowed hall,
Islay's allies slayed the young,
As chaos reigned in mortal fall.

And in the western realm 'cross seas,
The state-by-state, a guide does loom,
Where life begins, or cease to be,
Abortion's legal dance of doom.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: Why this is a bad time to check your 401(k)

feedItems.title: Suspected Islamic State Allies Kill at Least 37 High-School Students in Uganda
feedItems.description: Three adults were also killed as gunmen attacked a private boarding school near the East African country’s border with eastern Congo.

feedItems.title: Where Is Abortion Legal in the U.S.? A State-by-State Guide to Abortion Access
feedItems.description: Abortion access in the U.S. has changed considerably since the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. Track where abortion is now legal, banned or under threat.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
When banks of the west collapsed, array,
The loyal goats their stock did trust,
Sacrificed and now dismayed,
Workers of the California dust.

Off his caper of yore, Biden,
Like rabbit's fruitful brood, a sign,
With throngs of labor, nighted kin,
His blessing to serenade define.

Above a snail's pace now, I-95,
Haste brings bridge and travelers,
Governor plans a lively jive,
'Neath the river's watchful purlers.

feedItems.title: When SVB and First Republic Collapsed, So Did Their Employees' Investments
feedItems.description: Workers at the failed California banks plowed their money into company stock.

feedItems.title: Biden Touts Job Growth in First Re-Election Campaign Rally
feedItems.description: The Democratic president spoke before the AFL-CIO, which has given him a historically early endorsement.

feedItems.title: Collapsed I-95 Overpass in Philadelphia to Reopen in Two Weeks
feedItems.description: A temporary fix will allow vehicles to use the busy highway while engineers work on a permanent solution, the governor says.
